predictions.text: U.S. Nonfarm Payrolls (change in total nonfarm employment, SA) for October 2025 will print between +100,000 and +220,000.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify in BLS Employment Situation news release for October 2025: headline change in total nonfarm payroll employment.
evidence: Companies citing AI for layoffs suggest cooling hiring momentum: https://www.cnbc.com/2025/10/19/firms-are-blaming-ai-for-job-cuts-critics-say-its-a-good-excuse.html

Mixed global growth backdrop (China slowing) may temper U.S. labor demand: https://www.cnbc.com/2025/10/20/china-economic-growth-gdp-september-third-quarter-q3-retail-sales-industrial-output-urban-investment-fixed-income.html
monitoring_signals: Initial and continuing jobless claims (weekly, SA)
predictions.rationale: Hiring remains positive but moderating amid restructuring and macro uncertainty.

predictions.text: ISM Services Prices Index for October 2025 will print at or above 56.0.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm in ISM Services Report On Business for October 2025: Prices Index reading.
evidence: Services inflation persistence remains a theme in 2025 macro commentary.
Energy and wage pressures can keep services input prices elevated despite goods disinflation.
monitoring_signals: Wage growth measures (Atlanta Fed Wage Growth Tracker)
Oil and refined product price trends
predictions.rationale: Services price pressures remain sticky even as goods disinflate.

predictions.text: Seasonally adjusted insured unemployment (continuing claims) will print at or above 1.90 million in at least one weekly report by 2025-11-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Check U.S. Department of Labor Unemployment Insurance Weekly Claims report: seasonally adjusted insured unemployment level.
evidence: Reports of AI-linked restructuring and cost control point to slower re-hiring: https://www.cnbc.com/2025/10/19/firms-are-blaming-ai-for-job-cuts-critics-say-its-a-good-excuse.html
predictions.rationale: Gradual softening in labor markets should lift continuing claims.

predictions.text: Euro area HICP headline (YoY, flash) for October 2025 will print between 2.2% and 2.8%.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify in Eurostat flash inflation release for October 2025: headline HICP YoY.
evidence: Core inflation easing but still elevated per recent euro area trends.
Energy base effects fading with modest gas price volatility.
monitoring_signals: Country CPI flashes (DE, FR, ES, IT)
predictions.rationale: Headline likely near 2–3% as disinflation continues but services stay firm.

predictions.text: China imports (USD, YoY) for October 2025 will print between -2% and +6% in the Customs release.
predictions.verification_criteria: Check General Administration of Customs monthly trade data for October 2025: imports YoY in USD terms.
evidence: China growth slowing but policy support ongoing: https://www.cnbc.com/2025/10/20/china-economic-growth-gdp-september-third-quarter-q3-retail-sales-industrial-output-urban-investment-fixed-income.html
PBOC holding benchmark rates steady indicates cautious stance: https://www.cnbc.com/2025/10/20/asia-pacific-markets-nikkei-225-hang-seng-index-china-gdp.html
monitoring_signals: Commodity import volumes (crude, copper, iron ore)
predictions.rationale: Import growth remains subdued amid domestic demand softness.

predictions.text: U.S. Existing Home Sales (SAAR) for September 2025 will print between 3.8 million and 4.2 million in the NAR release.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify in National Association of Realtors press release for September 2025: seasonally adjusted annual rate of existing home sales.
evidence: High mortgage rates have depressed resale activity through 2025.
Inventory constraints limit upside even if rates ease modestly.
predictions.rationale: Elevated mortgage rates and tight supply cap transactions.

predictions.text: ICE U.S. Dollar Index (DXY) will close at or below 103.00 on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm using ICE Data Indices official DXY end-of-day close (or equivalent reputable financial data source).
evidence: Expectation of FOMC hold near-term reduces upside dollar impulse.
Improving risk sentiment in APAC equities: https://www.cnbc.com/2025/10/20/asia-pacific-markets-nikkei-225-hang-seng-index-china-gdp.html
predictions.rationale: Softer U.S. rates and risk-on episodes can pressure DXY lower.

predictions.text: ICE Brent crude oil front-month futures will settle at or below $80.00 per barrel on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify via ICE Futures Europe official daily settlement price for Brent front-month contract.
evidence: China growth concerns weigh on demand: https://www.cnbc.com/2025/10/20/china-economic-growth-gdp-september-third-quarter-q3-retail-sales-industrial-output-urban-investment-fixed-income.html
Geopolitical risks exist but have produced volatile, two-sided moves.
monitoring_signals: U.S. crude and product inventory builds
predictions.rationale: Demand-side softness could intermittently push Brent below $80.

predictions.text: U.S. working natural gas in storage will reach at or above 3.90 trillion cubic feet in at least one EIA Weekly Natural Gas Storage Report by 2025-11-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Check EIA Weekly Natural Gas Storage Report: total working gas in storage level for any report published by deadline.
evidence: EU storage very high points to mild price pressures globally: https://agsi.gie.eu/
Seasonal U.S. injections typically peak in Oct/Nov barring early draws.
monitoring_signals: Lower-48 dry gas production and LNG feedgas
predictions.rationale: Strong production and mild autumn weather support higher inventories.

predictions.text: U.S. Retail Sales Control Group (MoM, SA) for October 2025 will print between -0.2% and +0.3% in the Census release.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify in U.S. Census Monthly Retail Trade report for October 2025: control group (sales excluding motor vehicles & parts, gasoline, building materials, and food services).
evidence: Household finances mixed; some support from forgiveness policies: https://www.cnbc.com/2025/10/19/trump-student-loan-forgiveness.html
predictions.rationale: Flat-to-soft control sales amid cautious consumers and lower goods prices.

predictions.text: The U.S. 10-Year TIPS breakeven inflation rate (FRED: T10YIE) will close at or above 2.50% on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm using FRED series T10YIE daily close (or U.S. Treasury/TIPS market data).
evidence: Services inflation persistence and energy volatility can buoy long-run breakevens.
Policy on hold reduces near-term tightening risk.
predictions.rationale: Inflation risk premia can lift breakevens on data or oil spikes.

predictions.text: Microsoft (MSFT) Q1 FY2026 Azure and other cloud services revenue growth (YoY, constant currency) will be between 25% and 32%, per the company’s earnings disclosure.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify in Microsoft Q1 FY2026 earnings release/call: reported YoY growth rate for Azure and other cloud services (constant currency).
evidence: Enterprise AI adoption supports cloud demand; companies citing AI in restructuring: https://www.cnbc.com/2025/10/19/firms-are-blaming-ai-for-job-cuts-critics-say-its-a-good-excuse.html
predictions.rationale: Azure growth decelerates from peaks but stays robust on AI workloads.

predictions.text: Apple (AAPL) fiscal Q4 2025 Services net sales will grow between 12% and 18% year-over-year, per the company’s earnings release.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify in Apple fiscal Q4 2025 earnings press release: Services net sales YoY growth.
evidence: Services resilience amid device cycles; recurring revenue strength.
U.S. consumers supported at the margin by forgiveness policy: https://www.cnbc.com/2025/10/19/trump-student-loan-forgiveness.html
predictions.rationale: Services mix and subscriptions underpin double-digit growth despite FX.
